carousel_items: If you're sexually active, you and your partner should use birth control, since Azathioprine can cause birth defects.
If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, your joint damage canâ€™t be reversed, so keep up with your physical therapy and get plenty of rest.
While taking Azathioprine, your body is susceptible to infection; so be sure to wash your hands often and keep distance from with people who are sick.
It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

basics.benefits_moa: Azathioprine is an immunosuppressant medication. It blocks the production of the white blood cells that kill unfamiliar cells.
basics.bottom_line: Azathioprine is an effective medication for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and transplant rejection, but comes with a heavy list of side effects.
downsides: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

downsides_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

upsides: Azathioprine has proven to be effective in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
Azathioprine decreases the pain, stiffness, and swelling that most people have with rheumatoid arthritis.
You can still get vaccinated for the flu while taking Azathioprine.
Drinking alcohol is okay while taking Azathioprine.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents organ rejection and relieves joint pain and inflammation.

userStories.tip: It attacked my liver and kidneys.  I developed drug induced diabetes.  Everything cleared up when I was switched to cellcept.

userStories.identifier: busy Engineer with severe Crohn's Diseas
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: One of the side effect was muscular and skeletal pain. After 2-3 weeks on the medication I was unable to walk without the aid of two walking sticks. Symptoms last for many months after stopping the medication.

drugs.name: Imuran

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you're sexually active, you and your partner should use birth control, since Azathioprine can cause birth defects.
If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, your joint damage canâ€™t be reversed, so keep up with your physical therapy and get plenty of rest.
While taking Azathioprine, your body is susceptible to infection; so be sure to wash your hands often and keep distance from with people who are sick.
It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Azathioprine has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Azathioprine has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

risks_warnings.title: Decreased blood cells
risks_warnings.description: Though your doctor will order tests to make sure the level of Azathioprine in your blood is safe, can cause a decrease in the amount of blood cells your body has. This may also lead to a suppression and toxicity of your bone marrow. People with low to no thiopurine S-methyltransferase (TMPT) activity have a higher chance of this.

description_processed.orig: Though your doctor will order tests to make sure the level of Azathioprine in your blood is safe, can cause a decrease in the amount of blood cells your body has. This may also lead to a suppression and toxicity of your bone marrow. People with low to no thiopurine S-methyltransferase (TMPT) activity have a higher chance of this.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infection
risks_warnings.description: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

description_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Azathioprine has been known to cause a decrease in the amount, and quality of sperm temporarily. It has also been known to cause harm to the fetus. For these reasons, it is important to use medically acceptable forms of contraception while receiving Azathioprine. In certain conditions however, the benefits of taking Azathioprine outweigh the risks, and pregnant women should continue taking it.
